basics.name: Akarsh SEGGEMU
basics.label: Mobie Application Developer
basics.summary: Ever since I built my first Windows Phone app during final year of my Bachelor studies (i.e. Computer Science & Engineering), I have a passion for developing apps that stay in align with mobile usability guidelines. On 7 December 2017, I completed my master's degree in Computer Science from Technische Universitaet Berlin, Berlin. Self-taught Application developer (i.e. Windows Phone, Windows 8, Android and iOS), specializing in native apps. I have created apps for Windows Phone, Windows 8, Android and iOS that follow human interface design guidelines and fit into Windows, Android and iOS ecosystem with distinct branding.

highlights: Guided and supported app and game developers in their integration with Fyber products i.e. Fyber native SDKs, plugins and APIs.
Received and resolved escalations from the app and game developers as well as account management relating to SDK and API integration, reporting discrepancies, use of the dashboard etc.

Used a variety of tools such as log analysis, SQL queries, Fyber in-house tools and worked closely with different teams (i.e. engineering, product and business intelligence) to get to the bottom of an issue.
Actively managed ongoing escalations and communicated with clients (external, mainly phone but onsite from time to time as well) and account management teams in the process of resolution.
Continuously helped to improve the operational workflow within the solution engineering organization by improving documentation as well as ticketing and prioritization processes.
Provided coaching and guidance in the analysis and resolution of issues.
Helped in setting up systems to monitor the health of integrations and products in use by clients and escalate irregularities.

work.position: Solution Engineer, App and Games - Werkstudent
highlights: Supported in integration and optimization of Fyber products for Fyber customers.
Investigated irregularities, malfunctions and issues related to Fyber products.
Produced functional projects for integrating Fyber products in Unity 3D, Android and iOS.
Tracked customer issues by using JIRA, documented internal projects in the internal wiki.
Actively tested software features using both, manual and automated tests.
Reported test results and errors to the development team.
Assisted in the preparation of test plans for software testing.
Improved and maintained the quality of workflows and procedures.
Built wrappers for online-shops based in APAC zone market (i.e., Philippines, Indonesia, and, Singapore)
Managed database tables & updated tables with the new crawled data from online- shops on daily basis
Documented project workflow in internal wiki documentation
Tracked internal issues using JIRA.
Created maps of Berlin with geodatabase using GIS tools (i.e., PostGIS, OpenJump)
Maintained simulation programming scripts
Documented project workflow in internal wiki portal of DLR.
Created a functional windows phone 7.5 application for flight search, scheduling & ticket booking
Documented the project workflow and tests in MS word
Created a C# application to parse & create a Microsoft Excel file containing logs of SQL database tables of a magazine application published in iOS & Windows 8
Created an android application to implement Google Cloud Messaging Service (GCMS).
Created a functional application on windows 8 using metro user interface (UI)
Trained several students on Windows 8 application development.
Created a functional windows phone 7.5 application for integration of Microsoft Dynamics CRM
Documented implementation of CRM in MS word.
Created several functional applications in windows phone 7 & 7.5

publications.name: Speech Processing, Speech Synthesis & Speech Recognition
publications.summary: Speech recognition is an input system that consists of a microphone and speech recognition software. Speech recognition software is complex. Sounds received via a microphone must be broken down into phonemes; then, a “best guess” algorithm is used to match phonemes and syllables to a database of possible words. To solve speech inconsistencies like accent, volume, pitch, and inflection, male vs. female, sarcasm, and colloquialisms, the software must examine context and word patterns to determine the correct meaning. This requires an enormous database, which in turn requires a computer with very capable processing speed and memory. Speech recognition will greatly change the way information is input. Ease, convenience, and speed are three advantages to using a microphone instead of a keyboard. Speech recognition technology will have an impact on all careers but especially education. Business Education teachers must stay abreast of this technology and be willing to adjust their courses to best prepare students.

references.name: Prathap Reddy
references.reference: Akarsh is very good team member and he always try to adopt to new technologies especially i like his dedication in work

references.name: Ravindra Penumarthi
references.reference: Akarsh has excellent developer skills and in depth knowledge on .NET Framework, Windows Phone and Windows Azure. I was in awe many times looking at the way he used API's in Windows Phone applications(i was a noob back then). He made app development look easy. I got to know about azure for the first time from Akarsh when we were working together at Edukinect. I still remember that day(2 years ago) when he explained everything in the air about Azure and SQL Azure connectivity and today i'm an Azure developer and finally i figured out what he was talking on that day.

references.name: Bruno Granja Camarero
references.reference: Team-oriented, trustworthy and extremely focused on getting things done and achieving goals in order to deliver even more than what is expected. He is very assertive and proactive when dealing with every situation. And something I really appreciate: he is always keeping a positive vibe making work a lot easier and lighter. It was a pleasure to work with him.

references.name: Alexandra Toader
references.reference: Was a pleasure working with you. Result oriented, fast learner and a great team player. You would definitely have a valuable impact on any of the companies you would join in the future.

references.name: Victor Castano
references.reference: In a nutshell, Akarsh is one of the success stories at Fyber. He started as a Student Solution Engineer and quickly become an essential part of the team. Akarsh has a solid academic background, is very technical and customer oriented. With a wide mobile development background, Akarsh would be an asset to any organisation looking for a loyal and motivated engineer.
